intro: Meximalva filipes, commonly known as the silky mallow, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy stems and large, palmately lobed leaves. Its showy, pink to purple flowers bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Meximalva filipes is often found in moist, shaded environments like forests and stream banks.
